thread.title: BWXT gets NASA contract for consolidated facility, maintenance services
thread.title_full: BWXT gets NASA contract for consolidated facility, maintenance services

author: Gulli Arnason
title: BWXT gets NASA contract for consolidated facility, maintenance services
text:
BWXT Nuclear Operations Group, Inc., was selected by NASA for the Synergy Achieving Consolidated Operations & Maintenance (SACOM) contract.If all options are exercised, the maximum potential value for S3 is USD1.2 billion.The SACOM award is a consolidation of contracts at two NASA facilities — the Stennis Space Center in Hancock County, Miss., and the Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans, La. — that will provide facility operations and maintenance services for institutional and technical facilities, and perform test and manufacturing support services.The S3 contract includes a one-year base period that begins October 1. An additional seven option periods are available, bringing the total possible contract length to nine years and five months.Headquartered in Lynchburg, Va., BWX Technologies is a leading supplier of nuclear components and fuel to the US government; provides technical, management and site services to support governments in the operation of complex facilities and environmental remediation activities; and supplies precision manufactured components and services for the commercial nuclear power industry. BWXT has more than 5,200 employees and significant operations in Lynchburg, Va.; Erwin, Tenn.; Mount Vernon, Ind.; Euclid, Ohio; Barberton, Ohio; and Cambridge, Ontario, as well as more than a dozen US Department of Energy sites around the country.PAE is a leading provider of enduring support for the essential missions of the US government, its allied partners and international organizations. It has a workforce of approximately 15,000 people in over 50 countries across all seven continents and is headquartered in Arlington, VA.
